content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

In Julia, you can write this function as follows:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words)::Array{String, 1}
    valid_names = Array{String, 1}()
    for word in words
        if isuppercase(word[1]) && length(word) > 1 # Checks if the first character is upper case and not empty string
            push!(valid_names, word)
        end
    end
    return valid_names
end
```
This function iterates over each `word` in the input list. It checks whether the first letter of the word (`word[1]`) is an uppercase letter using the `isuppercase` function. If it's true, then this word will be added to the valid names array by using `push!`. Finally, the function returns the array of valid names.

You can call this function like:
```julia
words = ["dog", "Dog", "Cat", "", "Elephant", "Fox"]
valid_names = keep_only_names(words)
println(valid_names) # Outputs: String["Dog","Cat","Elephant","Fox"]
```
